simpleEnrichr 0.1.0

Enrichment barplot for two ORA enrichment objects

GSEA_two_barplot.Rd

Plot enrichment barplot for two ORA enrichment objects.

Usage

GSEA_two_barplot(
  enrich.obj,
  Selct.P = c("FDR", "P"),
  cutoff.P = 0.05,
  type.colors = c("#ED6355", "#3E94B5"),
  pos.top.pathway.num = 10,
  neg.top.pathway.num = 10,
  bar.width = 0.6,
  add.bar.border = T,
  x.limit.fold = 1.05,
  label.size = 3.5,
  legend.position = "bottom"
)

Arguments

enrich.obj

An gseaResult object from clusterProfiler.

Selct.P

P value (P) or adjust P value (FDR) were selected to define significant terms.

cutoff.P

A cutoff value for Select.P.

type.colors

Two colors for the positive and negative enrichment.

pos.top.pathway.num

The number of top pathways in positive terms. Based on the significant test.

neg.top.pathway.num

The number of top pathways in negative terms. Based on the significant test.

bar.width

Width of bar in the plot.

add.bar.border

Logical. Whether to add the black border of bars.

x.limit.fold

Specify the fold of x limitation.

label.size

Fontsize of label.

legend.position

none, left, right, top, bottom; Or Two numeric variables indicated x and y positions, respectively.

Examples

data(geneList, package="DOSE")

# Set enrich.type using an enrichment analysis method mentioned above.
fit <- simple_GSEA(geneList, enrich.type = "KEGG", gene.type = "ENTREZID")
#> ℹ Performing KEGG enrichment...
#> ℹ 55 significant terms were detected..
#> ✔ Done!
GSEA_two_barplot(fit)
